image.altText: An orange car is full of happy people, one is holding a fish in the air. The car is on the beach and it is dark.

items.synopsis: A rag-tag team of engineers, commercial divers and rev-heads have driven 7km under water across the Darwin Harbour, in a stunt they claim has broken two world records.

title.children: Team drives 7km under water across Darwin Harbour, but takes five hours longer than expected

image.altText: women standing alongside a conveyor belt, removing contaminants from food waste

items.synopsis: There are fears for the lasting success of the household food and garden waste program due to widespread contamination, but there are solutions being trialled.

title.children: 'We are deadly serious': FOGO industry urges Australians to care about their food scraps as system 'overwhelmed'

image.altText: investigators dress in personal protective equipment on a boat

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says "every Australian" is feeling for the families, friends and colleagues of those missing.

title.children: Army aviators still missing, search-and-rescue mission continues after Taipan helicopter crash

image.altText: A woman speaks at a lectern

items.synopsis: The federal water minister has a dilemma. She's got a whole lot of water to find and not a whole lot of time, writes Kath Sullivan.

title.children: Tanya Plibersek made a public confession. But it was another quiet comment that's more shocking

image.altText: A man and woman in white shirts smile while they gather together under a tent with other people sitting and chatting

items.synopsis: Israel is rapidly expanding settlements in the West Bank, in a move that goes against international law and which activists say is designed to permanently establish Jewish Israelis on land that Palestinians want as a future state.

title.children: This Australian man's home is illegal under international law. But he won't move

image.altText: Police in white forensic coveralls

items.synopsis: Long Island police say they have finally caught the serial killer who dumped his victims along the shores of Gilgo Beach, thanks to a stash of burner phones, a forgotten clue and a pizza crust.

title.children: As American police searched for the Gilgo Beach serial killer, they zeroed in on a local suburban dad

image.altText: Donald Trump pictured making a fist while speaking into microphone at podium with US flag in background.

items.synopsis: A US federal judge throws out Donald Trump's defamation lawsuit against CNN, in which the former president claimed the network's description of his election fraud as the "big lie" associated him with Adolf Hitler.

title.children: Trump's $714 million 'big lie' defamation lawsuit against CNN dismissed

image.altText: Women wearing grey suits pose for a photo while holding champagnes and a calendar

items.synopsis: It was described as both "empowering" and "shocking" and was used to raise the profile of the Matildas — but a nude calendar in 1999 saw the team get far more than they bargained for.

title.children: 'We didn't think we'd get something as confronting': Inside the nude calendar that got the Matildas in trouble with the government

image.altText: A composite of two images: A man wears white gloves as he holds up a Hermes handbag, and a generic pen of crocodiles.

items.synopsis: Australia's secretive crocodile farming industry is about to go under the microscope, with the federal government reviewing the rules on how the predators can be caught, farmed and killed.

title.children: Luxury handbag industry under scrutiny as review into crocodile farming announced

image.altText: A woman browses through a rack of skirts.

items.synopsis: An Adelaide charity says it is struggling to fill its op shop shelves this winter, as people feeling the pinch under rising cost-of-living pressures turn to selling unwanted goods online instead of donating them.

title.children: Cupboard bare for op shops as cost-of-living crisis deters donations

image.altText: A man in army fatigues stands in front of the Ukrainian flag

items.synopsis: The Ukrainian President has proved a curse for Russia, uniting his nation while garnering western support for his cause. But how good a military strategist is he? And to what extent has he held his side together, asks John Lyons.

title.children: What makes Zelenskyy an 'exceptional' leader, according to four experts who've seen him up close and personal

image.altText: Belarusian soldiers and Wagner private military company attend the weeklong manoeuvres in Belarus.

items.synopsis: Over 100 mercenaries belonging to the Wagner group in Belarus move close to the border, the Polish prime minister says, raising fears they could sneak into Poland as migrants.

title.children: Poland raises alarm as Wagner forces move closer to border

image.altText: A car and caravan destroyed by a crash on the roadside.

items.synopsis: Untrained, inexperienced and a potential hazard to themselves and everyone else on the road. This is the scenario many drivers face when they tow a caravan for the first time.

title.children: Getting hitched with no experience prompts calls for mandatory towing training

image.altText: Numbered lottery balls mid-air.

items.synopsis: The State Revenue Office says one former Box Hill resident has more than $800,000 waiting to be collected.

title.children: More than $100 million still to be claimed by Victorians

image.altText: A white man sits up front of a canoe with cap and open collar with an African man behind, both paddling.

items.synopsis: Alan Carle was hunting otherworldly fruit with fluorescent tentacles and bubbly flesh that folks back home had never even heard about, much less tasted — and he was willing to risk his life to find it.

title.children: Tigers, gunfights and rare rambutans are part of life for the Indiana Jones of exotic fruits

image.altText: A SA Police car drives on a dirt road

items.synopsis: The aircraft was taking off at Brentwood, on South Australia's Yorke Peninsula, when it hit the horse and crashed, SA Police say.

title.children: Light plane collides with horse in South Australia, police say

image.altText: Sam Kerr drinks a coffee at a Matildas training session in Brisbane.

items.synopsis: The Matildas skipper attends training following the news she's available to face Canada, while an England star may yet return to the field at the World Cup after sustaining a knee injury — these are five talking points on day 11 of the tournament.

title.children: Five quick hits – excitement builds ahead of Sam Kerr's return, England receives positive news

image.altText: A graphic showing three cut out headshots of Chloe Hayden, with sparkly star and rainbow stickers.

items.synopsis: Growing up, Chloé Hayden didn't speak to people outside her family for a decade. Now 26, she's a Logie-nominated actor, a social media influencer, and an outspoken disability advocate — but the road to get there wasn't easy.

title.children: Chloé Hayden barely spoke for 10 years. Now she performs for a living

image.altText: Brisbane airport. Plane coming into landing. Virgin

items.synopsis: The men face fines after allegedly causing a flight from Brisbane to Indonesia to be diverted to Darwin due to disruptive behaviour.

title.children: Three Brisbane men kicked off flight for allegedly vaping, drinking duty-free alcohol on board

image.altText: A helicopter comes into land on a grass field.

items.synopsis: In the latest chapter in its troubled history, four people are feared dead after an Australian Army helicopter crashed into the ocean. It's not the first time concerns have been raised about Taipan choppers.

title.children: Exploring the troubled history of the Australian Army's Taipan helicopters

image.altText: A graphic with three pieces of steak with dollar signs signs over them.

items.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate is the lowest in almost 50 years. That's good news, but not if you're throwing a barbecue. Here's why.

title.children: Cattle prices are down and the herd is growing, so why is steak still so expensive?

image.altText: Gold Coast nursery owner stands in front of his plants

items.synopsis: Fire ant exterminations were left unfinished for months while government contractors took up to six "smoko breaks" per day, according to department documents.

title.children: Fire ant program plagued by delays, unfinished sprays and smoko breaks, documents reveal

image.altText: Image of two people crossing a river wearing bee suits.

items.synopsis: Australian bee experts are aiding a Fijian biosecurity program targeting killer pests in a joint surveillance effort to protect beekeepers and agriculture.

title.children: Australian bee experts lead biosecurity efforts in Fiji against varroa mite, killer pests

image.altText: Balmain stabbing

items.synopsis: NSW Police allege the 29-year-old man, who died in hospital, was stabbed multiple times during an altercation in Balmain involving two other men who fled the scene in a vehicle.

title.children: Man stabbed to death in Sydney's inner west was 'low-level associate with organised crime'

image.altText: Hawks v Saints

items.synopsis: St Kilda are stumbling on the way to September, so a win over Hawthorn is absolutely crucial. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Hawks hoping to upset finals-chasing Saints

image.altText: A Wests Tigers NRLW player runs with the ball in her right hand.

items.synopsis: Newcomers Wests Tigers and Cronulla meet at Belmore in the second game of a double header, after defending premier Newcastle go down to North Queensland. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.

title.children: NRLW live: Wests Tigers take on Cronulla at Belmore after Cowboys stun the Knights

image.altText: Pat Cummins looks despondent

items.synopsis: Australia's bowlers arrived at The Oval on day three knowing there was a window of opportunity to lead their team to a famous Ashes win. Within an hour, that prospect had been blown out of the water.

title.children: In one dismal hour of bowling, Australia's hopes at The Oval are blown away

image.altText: A woman smiles on a stage in front of a crowd.

items.synopsis: Both the Labor and Liberal parties are claiming the by-election result as a positive, but the truth is somewhere in the middle, writes state political reporter Keane Bourke.

title.children: How the Rockingham by-election shows what WA politics may look like without the Mark McGowan factor

image.altText: Ella sits at an outdoor table covered with greek sweets, she is wearing a blue and white shirt and there are vines behind her

items.synopsis: I knew I wanted to work at the mountaintop Ntounias taverna in Crete. I didn't know it would help me tap into a special memory from my childhood.

title.children: I spent the summer working in a taverna in Crete. It brought me back to who I am

image.altText: Comeroo station 6_Credit - Joshua J Smith Photography

items.synopsis: The ABC is given access to pastoral Comeroo Station in remote NSW, soon to be converted to national parkland, protecting a healthy and unique river system.

title.children: 'Special landscape': $13m deal to turn remote NSW pastoral property into national park

image.altText: The Ngunnawal Bush Healing Farm

items.synopsis: The $12 million purpose-built health facility for Indigenous people in Canberra's south has been open for over six years, but its eight beds have never been slept in.

title.children: 'Smoke and mirrors': Ngunnawal Bush Healing Farm not being run as promised, board members say

image.altText: Ironhand in use

items.synopsis: Karim worked with knives and tools for years, but it was a broken coffee cup that caused his injury. Now a bionic hand is helping him take up blacksmithing again.

title.children: Karim lost his blacksmith practice due to a hand injury, but a bionic device has changed everything

image.altText: Two Port Adelaide Power AFL players receive attention from medical staff after a head clash.

items.synopsis: Port Adelaide coach Ken Hinkley bristles at the suggestion key defender Aliir Aliir returned to the field without being properly assessed following a collision with teammate Lachie Jones.

title.children: Power defend club doctor's decision after sickening head clash in Showdown loss
